projectPurpose: To serve as a curated, central index for discovering high-quality Rust code, resources, and tools within the Rust programming language ecosystem.
mainFeatures: Curated list of Rust code and resources

alternatives.name: crates.io
alternatives.license: Apache 2.0, MIT (for the registry software; individual crates have their own licenses)

alternatives.name: lib.rs
alternatives.license: Various (as it indexes crates with different licenses)
mainFeatures: Focus on discoverability and quality metrics

alternatives.name: Blessed.rs
alternatives.license: Various (as it recommends crates with different licenses)
mainFeatures: Hand-curated recommendations for common use cases

marketPositioning: Awesome-rust positions itself as a high-level, community-curated entry point into the Rust ecosystem. It complements official resources like crates.io and the Rust documentation by providing a filtered, subjectively 'awesome' collection of projects and resources across various categories. Its strength lies in its human-powered curation, offering a more guided discovery experience compared to the exhaustive search capabilities of package registries. It is particularly valuable for users looking for recommended and established solutions or wanting to explore the breadth of what's available in Rust in an organized manner.
